Package io.dimeformat

Class IdentityIssuingRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.dimeformat.Item
      • io.dimeformat.IdentityIssuingRequest
  • public class IdentityIssuingRequest
extends Item
    Class used to create a request for the issuing of an identity to an entity. This will contain a locally generated public key (where the private key remains locally), capabilities requested and principles claimed. An issuing entity uses the Identity Issuing Request (IIR) to validate and then issue a new identity for the entity.

    • Method Detail

      • getHeader

        public java.lang.String getHeader()
        Description copied from class: Item
        Returns the item header of the DiME item. This can be used to identify the type of DiME item held in this generic class. It is also used in the exported DiME format to indicate the beginning of a DiME item inside an envelope. Typically, this is represented by a short series of letters.
        Specified by:
        getHeader in class Item
        Returns:
        The item header of the DiME item.

      • getPublicKey

        public Key getPublicKey()
        Returns the public key attached to the IIR. This is the public key attached by the entity and will get included in any issued identity. The equivalent secret (private) key was used to sign the IIR, thus the public key can be used to verify the signature. This must be a key of type IDENTITY.
        Returns:
        A Key instance with a public key of type IDENTITY.

      • getCapabilities

        public java.util.List<IdentityCapability> getCapabilities()
        Returns a list of any capabilities requested by this IIR. Capabilities are usually used to determine what an entity may do with its issued identity.
        Returns:
        An immutable list of Capability instances.

      • getPrinciples

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getPrinciples()
        Returns all principles provided in the IIR. These are key-value fields that further provide information about the entity. Using principles are optional.
        Returns:
        An immutable map of assigned principles.

      • generateIIR

        public static IdentityIssuingRequest generateIIR​(Key key)
                                          throws CryptographyException
        This will generate a new IIR from a Key instance. The Key instance must be of type IDENTITY.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key instance to use.
        Returns:
        An IIR that can be used to issue a new identity (or sent to a trusted entity for issuing).
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateIIR

        public static IdentityIssuingRequest generateIIR​(Key key,
                                                 IdentityCapability[] capabilities)
                                          throws CryptographyException
        This will generate a new IIR from a Key instance and a list of wished for capabilities. The Key instance must be of type IDENTITY.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key instance to use.
        capabilities - A list of capabilities that should be requested.
        Returns:
        An IIR that can be used to issue a new identity (or sent to a trusted entity for issuing).
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • generateIIR

        public static IdentityIssuingRequest generateIIR​(Key key,
                                                 IdentityCapability[] capabilities,
                                                 java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> principles)
                                          throws CryptographyException
        This will generate a new IIR from a Key instance together with a list of wished for capabilities and principles to include in any issued identity. The Key instance must be of type IDENTITY.
        Parameters:
        key - The Key instance to use.
        capabilities - A list of capabilities that should be requested.
        principles - A map of key-value fields that should be included in an issued identity.
        Returns:
        An IIR that can be used to issue a new identity (or sent to a trusted entity for issuing).
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If something goes wrong.

      • wantsCapability

        public boolean wantsCapability​(IdentityCapability capability)
        Checks if the IIR includes a request for a particular capability.
        Parameters:
        capability - The capability to check for.
        Returns:
        true or false.

      • issueIdentity

        public Identity issueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                              long validFor,
                              Key issuerKey,
                              Identity issuerIdentity,
                              boolean includeChain,
                              IdentityCapability[] allowedCapabilities,
                              IdentityCapability[] requiredCapabilities)
                       throws CapabilityException,
                              CryptographyException,
                              IntegrityStateException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. This method should only be called after the IIR has been validated to meet context and application specific requirements. The only exception is the capabilities, that may be validated during the issuing, by providing allowed and required capabilities. The system name of the issued identity will be set to the same as the issuing identity.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        issuerIdentity - The Identity instance of the issuing entity. If part of a trust chain, then this will be attached to the newly issued Identity.
        includeChain - If set to true then the trust chain will be added to the newly issued identity. The chain will only the included if the issuing identity is not the root node.
        allowedCapabilities - A list of capabilities that may be present in the IIR to allow issuing.
        requiredCapabilities - A list of capabilities that will be added (if not present in the IIR) before issuing.
        Returns:
        An Identity instance that may be sent back to the entity that proved the IIR.
        Throws:
        CapabilityException - If the IIR contains any capabilities that are not allowed.
        IntegrityStateException - If verification fails.
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • issueIdentity

        public Identity issueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                              long validFor,
                              Key issuerKey,
                              Identity issuerIdentity,
                              boolean includeChain,
                              IdentityCapability[] allowedCapabilities,
                              IdentityCapability[] requiredCapabilities,
                              java.lang.String systemName,
                              java.lang.String[] ambit)
                       throws CapabilityException,
                              CryptographyException,
                              IntegrityStateException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. This method should only be called after the IIR has been validated to meet context and application specific requirements. The only exception is the capabilities, that may be validated during the issuing, by providing allowed and required capabilities. If system is omitted, then the issued identity will be set to the system same as the issuing identity.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        issuerIdentity - The Identity instance of the issuing entity. If part of a trust chain, then this will be attached to the newly issued Identity.
        includeChain - If set to true then the trust chain will be added to the newly issued identity. The chain will only the included if the issuing identity is not the root node.
        allowedCapabilities - A list of capabilities that must be present in the IIR to allow issuing.
        requiredCapabilities - A list of capabilities that will be added (if not present in the IIR) before issuing.
        systemName - The name of the system, or network, that the identity should be a part of.
        ambit - An ambit list that will apply to the issued identity.
        Returns:
        An Identity instance that may be sent back to the entity that proved the IIR.
        Throws:
        CapabilityException - If the IIR contains any capabilities that are not allowed.
        IntegrityStateException - If verification fails.
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • issueIdentity

        public Identity issueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                              long validFor,
                              Key issuerKey,
                              Identity issuerIdentity,
                              boolean includeChain,
                              IdentityCapability[] allowedCapabilities,
                              IdentityCapability[] requiredCapabilities,
                              java.lang.String systemName,
                              java.lang.String[] ambit,
                              java.lang.String[] methods)
                       throws CapabilityException,
                              CryptographyException,
                              IntegrityStateException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. This method should only be called after the IIR has been validated to meet context and application specific requirements. The only exception is the capabilities, that may be validated during the issuing, by providing allowed and required capabilities. If system is omitted, then the issued identity will be set to the system same as the issuing identity.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        issuerIdentity - The Identity instance of the issuing entity. If part of a trust chain, then this will be attached to the newly issued Identity.
        includeChain - If set to true then the trust chain will be added to the newly issued identity. The chain will only the included if the issuing identity is not the root node.
        allowedCapabilities - A list of capabilities that must be present in the IIR to allow issuing.
        requiredCapabilities - A list of capabilities that will be added (if not present in the IIR) before issuing.
        systemName - The name of the system, or network, that the identity should be a part of.
        ambit - An ambit list that will apply to the issued identity.
        methods - A list of methods that will apply to the issued identity.
        Returns:
        An Identity instance that may be sent back to the entity that proved the IIR.
        Throws:
        CapabilityException - If the IIR contains any capabilities that are not allowed.
        IntegrityStateException - If verification fails.
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • selfIssueIdentity

        public Identity selfIssueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                                  long validFor,
                                  Key issuerKey,
                                  java.lang.String systemName)
                           throws CryptographyException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. The issued identity will be self-issued as it will be signed by the same key that also created the IIR. This is normally used when creating a root identity for a trust chain.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        systemName - The name of the system, or network, that the identity should be a part of.
        Returns:
        A self-issued Identity instance.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

      • selfIssueIdentity

        public Identity selfIssueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                                  long validFor,
                                  Key issuerKey,
                                  java.lang.String systemName,
                                  java.lang.String[] ambit)
                           throws CryptographyException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. The issued identity will be self-issued as it will be signed by the same key that also created the IIR. This is normally used when creating a root identity for a trust chain.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        systemName - The name of the system, or network, that the identity should be a part of.
        ambit - An ambit list that will apply to the issued identity.
        Returns:
        A self-issued Identity instance.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.

        public Identity selfIssueIdentity​(java.util.UUID subjectId,
                                  long validFor,
                                  Key issuerKey,
                                  java.lang.String systemName,
                                  java.lang.String[] ambit,
                                  java.lang.String[] methods)
                           throws CryptographyException
        Will issue a new Identity instance from the IIR. The issued identity will be self-issued as it will be signed by the same key that also created the IIR. This is normally used when creating a root identity for a trust chain.
        Parameters:
        subjectId - The subject identifier of the entity. For a new identity this may be anything, for a re-issue it should be the same as subject identifier used previously.
        validFor - The number of seconds that the identity should be valid for, from the time of issuing.
        issuerKey - The Key of the issuing entity, must contain a secret key of type IDENTIFY.
        systemName - The name of the system, or network, that the identity should be a part of.
        ambit - An ambit list that will apply to the issued identity.
        methods - A list of methods that will apply to the issued identity.
        Returns:
        A self-issued Identity instance.
        Throws:
        CryptographyException - If anything goes wrong.
